description: This file implements the DownloadManagerHttpClient class, which manages HTTP downloads using libcurl in C++. It includes methods for initiating downloads with progress tracking, handling cleanup, and managing HTTP responses.

classes.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient
classes.description: Class responsible for managing HTTP downloads using libcurl, supporting progress updates and error handling.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Constructor initializing curl handle and member variables.

methods.name: ~DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Destructor cleaning up the curl handle and internal resources.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient::Status downloadFile(const std::string & url,const std::string & fileName,uint32_t rateLimit)
methods.description: Performs file download from a specified URL to a local file with rate limiting and progress tracking.

methods.name: size_t progressCb(void * ptr,double dltotal,double dlnow,double ultotal,double ulnow)
methods.description: Callback function invoked by libcurl to report download progress; updates internal progress state and handles cancellation.

methods.name: size_t write_data(void * ptr,size_t size,size_t nmemb,FILE * stream)
methods.description: Callback function for writing received data to a file stream.

ctags.name: progressCb
ctags.pattern: /^size_t DownloadManagerHttpClient::progressCb(void *ptr, double dltotal, double dlnow, double ult/
